author: Yashasvini Razdan
description:
Electronics manufacturing output in India has grown sixfold over the past decade, according to data tabled in Parliament by the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY). The shift is attributed to production-linked incentive (PLI) schemes, tax reforms, and infrastructure support. Electronic goods production increased from $21.8 billion in FY2015 to $129.9 billion in FY2025, […]

The post Policy Shifts Drive Sixfold Surge in India’s Electronics Output appeared first on EE Times.
title: Policy Shifts Drive Sixfold Surge in India’s Electronics Output
